parameters.name: FileName
parameters.description: Name of the file that has the coordinates for the table-driven pattern; can be an empty string (see Remarks )

parameters.name: PointVar
parameters.description: Array of x, y coordinates of the points for the table-driven pattern (see Remarks )

parameters.name: UseCentroid
parameters.description: True to use the centroid of the seed feature, face, or body; false to use a different point as the reference point (see Remarks )

parameters.name: GeomPattern
parameters.description: True to pattern the geometry, false to not

parameters.name: PropVisProps
parameters.description: True to propagate visual properties, false to not

title: IFeatureManager.InsertTableDrivenPattern2
description: Obsolete. See IFeatureManager::CreateFeature and the Remarks in ITablePatternFeatureData.
signature:
Feature InsertTableDrivenPattern2( 
   System.String
FileName
,
   System.Object
PointVar
,
   System.Boolean
UseCentroid
,
   System.Boolean
GeomPattern
,
   System.Boolean
PropVisProps
)

parameters.name: FileName
parameters.description: Name of the file that has the coordinates for the table-driven pattern; can be an empty string (see Remarks )

parameters.name: PointVar
parameters.description: Array of x, y coordinates of the points for the table-driven pattern (see Remarks )

parameters.name: UseCentroid
parameters.description: True to use the centroid of the seed feature, face, or body; false to use a different point as the reference point (see Remarks )

parameters.name: GeomPattern
parameters.description: True to pattern the geometry, false to not

parameters.name: PropVisProps
parameters.description: True to propagate visual properties, false to not

remarks:
Specify:
coordinates for the input points in system units in a
.sldptab
or
.txt
file for FileName.
- or -
input points in system units in PointVar. Because each point has two coordinates (x, y), the size of PointVar is (2 x number_of_points).
This method requires selecting the input entities using these selection marks:
Input entity
Mark
Seed feature
4
Coordinate system
16
Reference point
32
Seed face
128
Seed body
256
If UseCentroid is false, then you must specify a reference point.
See the SOLIDWORKS Help for more information about table-driven patterns.
